{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3413863,"name":"HOU SHANG WANG","username":"MonkeyWang07","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/monkeywang07/{size}/219528_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-07T01:59:36.156Z","cooked":"

When I turn on the power of the robot the CIM motor just keep turning no matter my robot has been connect to my computer or disable or not, it just always turn, have someone know what happen or some of tips that i can solve this problem? Thanks for helping.

Is the motor wired to a motor controller?

Or is it wired directly to the power distribution panel?

Are you absolutely sure? No motors should run unless the robot is enabled. If the motor always runs when you power the robot on (regardless of what code is running, or whether you connect a driver station or not), I would say you either have a wiring issue, or the motor controller is broken.

I think motor controllers in PWM mode had to have the ‚Äúzero‚Äù neutral calibrated so the motor was off when your code told it off. You didn‚Äôt say how fast the motors were going. If PWM and going rather slowly, then I suspect this is the problem.

Sorry for the late reply. Yes I am pretty sure that I already wired the motor to motor controller, when I recheck the LED status on my robot, it was blinking redÔºÜorange light, I think is my motor controller got ‚ÄúHardware Broken‚Äù Thank you for your help.

Sorry for the late reply. The motor is turning so fast, with my experience of driving Mecnaum drive I the the motor is ouyput 100% of it can, I think is the motor controller problem, I will try to change the motor controller tomorrow. BTW I am using CAN to link.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-08-11T11:49:32.258Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":57,"readers_count":56,"score":11.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469609,"topic_slug":"mecanumdrive-proble","display_username":"HOU SHANG WANG","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60197,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mecanumdrive-proble/469609/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414574,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-11T18:07:31.358Z","cooked":"

This is likely caused by wiring or a faulty motor controller, unlikely be a programming.

All FRC legal motor controller, if not receiving PWM signal (roboRIO will cut off PWM signal completely when disabled) or hartbeat from CAN bu, it will completely shut off output.

What you can do is

  1. Check wiring. Make sure you‚Äôre not connecting MC motor output to PDP and power input to motor, or reverse polarity on the power input.
  2. Check MC light.
  3. Unplug MC from roborio and see if this happen.
  4. try a new MC.
